001package com.technototes.library.control;
002
003import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
004import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
005import java.util.function.DoubleSupplier;
006
007import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad;
008
009import com.technototes.library.general.Enablable;
010import com.technototes.library.general.Periodic;
011
012/** A class to extend gamepads from, it does the internal processing for you.
013 * @author Alex Stedman
014 * @param <T> The class for the button components on the gamepad
015 * @param <U> The class for the axis components on the gamepad
016 */
017public class GamepadBase<T extends ButtonBase, U extends AxisBase> implements Periodic, Enablable<GamepadBase<T, U>> {
018    private boolean enabled = true;
019    // normal gamepad
020    private Gamepad gamepad;
021    // buttons
022    /** The button objects
023     *
024     */
025    public T a,
026            b,
027            x,
028            y,
029            start,
030            back,
031            leftBumper,
032            rightBumper,
033            cross,
034            circle,
035            square,
036            triangle,
037            share,
038            options,
039            dpadUp,
040            dpadDown,
041            dpadLeft,
042            dpadRight,
043            leftStickButton,
044            rightStickButton;
045    // axis
046    /** The axis objects
047     *
048     */
049    public U leftTrigger, rightTrigger, leftStickX, leftStickY, rightStickX, rightStickY;
050    // sticks
051    /** The stick objects
052     *
053     */
054    public GamepadStick<U, T> leftStick, rightStick;
055    // dpad
056    /** The dpad object
057     *
058     */
059    public GamepadDpad<T> dpad;
060    // periodics to run
061    private Periodic[] periodics;
062    private Enablable<?>[] enablables;
063
064    private Class<T> buttonClass;
065    private Class<U> axisClass;
066
067    /** Creates a gamepad with these parameters
068     *
069     * @param g The gamepad to base around
070     * @param bClass The class object passed for the button components (Should be the same as the one used for the class parameter T)
071     * @param aClass The class object passed for the axis components (Should be the same as the one used for the class parameter U)
072     */
073    public GamepadBase(Gamepad g, Class<T> bClass, Class<U> aClass) {
074        gamepad = g;
075        buttonClass = bClass;
076        axisClass = aClass;
077        try {
078            setComponents(g);
079        } catch (Exception e) {
080            e.printStackTrace();
081        }
082
083        leftStick = new GamepadStick<>(leftStickX, leftStickY, leftStickButton);
084        rightStick = new GamepadStick<>(rightStickX, rightStickY, rightStickButton);
085        dpad = new GamepadDpad<>(dpadUp, dpadDown, dpadLeft, dpadRight);
086        periodics = new Periodic[] {
087            a, b, x, y, start, back, leftBumper, rightBumper, leftTrigger, rightTrigger, leftStick, rightStick, dpad
088        };
089        enablables = new Enablable[] {
090            a, b, x, y, start, back, leftBumper, rightBumper, leftTrigger, rightTrigger, leftStick, rightStick, dpad
091        };
092    }
093
094    // to actually instantiate the objects
095    private void setComponents(Gamepad g)
096            throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
097
098        // buttons
099        // a=new T();
100        a = buttonInstance(() -> g.a);
101        b = buttonInstance(() -> g.b);
102        x = buttonInstance(() -> g.x);
103        y = buttonInstance(() -> g.y);
104        cross = a;
105        circle = b;
106        square = x;
107        triangle = y;
108
109        start = buttonInstance(() -> g.start);
110        back = buttonInstance(() -> g.back);
111        share = back;
112        options = start;
113
114        // bumpers
115        leftBumper = buttonInstance(() -> g.left_bumper);
116        rightBumper = buttonInstance(() -> g.right_bumper);
117
118        // dpad
119        dpadUp = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_up);
120        dpadDown = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_down);
121        dpadLeft = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_left);
122        dpadRight = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_right);
123
124        // left stick
125        leftStickX = axisInstance(() -> g.left_stick_x);
126        leftStickY = axisInstance(() -> g.left_stick_y);
127        leftStickButton = buttonInstance(() -> g.left_stick_button);
128
129        // right stick
130        rightStickX = axisInstance(() -> g.right_stick_x);
131        rightStickY = axisInstance(() -> g.right_stick_y);
132        rightStickButton = buttonInstance(() -> g.right_stick_button);
133
134        // triggers
135        leftTrigger = axisInstance(() -> g.left_trigger);
136        rightTrigger = axisInstance(() -> g.right_trigger);
137    }
138
139    // enums
140
141    /** Button enum for all buttons on gamepad
142     *
143     */
144    public enum Button {
145        A,
146        B,
147        X,
148        Y,
149        CROSS,
150        CIRCLE,
151        SQUARE,
152        TRIANGLE,
153        SHARE,
154        OPTIONS,
155        START,
156        BACK,
157        LEFT_BUMPER,
158        RIGHT_BUMPER,
159        LEFT_STICK_BUTTON,
160        RIGHT_STICK_BUTTON
161    }
162    /** Axis enum for all axis on gamepad
163     *
164     */
165    public enum Axis {
166        LEFT_STICK_X,
167        LEFT_STICK_Y,
168        RIGHT_STICK_X,
169        RIGHT_STICK_Y,
170        LEFT_TRIGGER,
171        RIGHT_TRIGGER
172    }
173
174    /** Returns a button
175     *
176     * @param bu The enum to choose which gamepad button to return
177     * @return The gamepad button that you choose with the enum
178     */
179    public T getButton(Button bu) {
180        switch (bu) {
181            case A:
182                return a;
183            case B:
184                return b;
185            case X:
186                return x;
187            case Y:
188                return y;
189            case CROSS:
190                return cross;
191            case CIRCLE:
192                return circle;
193            case SQUARE:
194                return square;
195            case TRIANGLE:
196                return triangle;
197            case SHARE:
198                return share;
199            case OPTIONS:
200                return options;
201            case BACK:
202                return back;
203            case START:
204                return start;
205            case LEFT_BUMPER:
206                return leftBumper;
207            case RIGHT_BUMPER:
208                return rightBumper;
209            case LEFT_STICK_BUTTON:
210                return leftStickButton;
211            case RIGHT_STICK_BUTTON:
212                return rightStickButton;
213            default:
214                return null;
215        }
216    }
217
218    /** Returns an axis
219     *
220     * @param as The enum for the axis that is wanted to be returned
221     * @return The chosen axis
222     */
223    public U getAxis(Axis as) {
224        switch (as) {
225            case LEFT_STICK_X:
226                return leftStickX;
227            case LEFT_STICK_Y:
228                return leftStickY;
229            case RIGHT_STICK_X:
230                return rightStickX;
231            case RIGHT_STICK_Y:
232                return rightStickY;
233            case LEFT_TRIGGER:
234                return leftTrigger;
235            case RIGHT_TRIGGER:
236                return rightTrigger;
237            default:
238                return null;
239        }
240    }
241
242    /** Returns a button as boolean
243     *
244     * @param bu The enum to specify which button to get as boolean
245     * @return The chosen button as boolean
246     */
247    public boolean getButtonAsBoolean(Button bu) {
248        return getButton(bu).getAsBoolean();
249    }
250    /** Returns an axis as double
251     *
252     * @param as The enum to specify which axis to get as double
253     * @return The chosen axis as double
254     */
255    public double getAxisAsDouble(Axis as) {
256        return getAxis(as).getAsDouble();
257    }
258    /** Returns an axis as boolean
259     *
260     * @param as The enum to specify which axis to get as boolean
261     * @return The chosen axis as boolean
262     */
263    public boolean getAxisAsBoolean(Axis as) {
264        return getAxis(as).getAsBoolean();
265    }
266
267    /** Returns the left stick
268     *
269     * @return The left stick on the gamepad
270     */
271    public GamepadStick<U, T> getLeftStick() {
272        return leftStick;
273    }
274    /** Returns the right stick
275     *
276     * @return The right stick on the gamepad
277     */
278    public GamepadStick<U, T> getRightStick() {
279        return rightStick;
280    }
281    /** Returns the Dpad object
282     *
283     * @return The dpad
284     */
285    public GamepadDpad<T> getDpad() {
286        return dpad;
287    }
288
289    @Override
290    public void periodic() {
291        if (isDisabled()) return;
292        for (Periodic p : periodics) {
293            p.periodic();
294        }
295    }
296
297    /** Returns the encapsulated gamepad
298     *
299     * @return The gamepad
300     */
301    public Gamepad getGamepad() {
302        return gamepad;
303    }
304
305    public T buttonInstance(BooleanSupplier b)
306            throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
307        return buttonClass.getConstructor(BooleanSupplier.class).newInstance(b);
308    }
309
310    public U axisInstance(DoubleSupplier d)
311            throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
312        return axisClass.getConstructor(DoubleSupplier.class).newInstance(d);
313    }
314
315    // rumble stuff
316    public void rumbleBlips(int blips) {
317        gamepad.rumbleBlips(blips);
318    }
319
320    public void rumbleBlip() {
321        rumbleBlips(1);
322    }
323
324    public void rumble(double seconds) {
325        gamepad.rumble((int) (seconds * 1000));
326    }
327
328    public boolean isRumbling() {
329        return gamepad.isRumbling();
330    }
331
332    public void stopRumble() {
333        gamepad.stopRumble();
334    }
335
336    public void rumble() {
337        rumble(120);
338    }
339
340    @Override
341    public GamepadBase<T, U> setEnabled(boolean enable) {
342        enabled = enable;
343        for (Enablable<?> enablable : enablables) enablable.setEnabled(enable);
344        return this;
345    }
346
347    @Override
348    public boolean isEnabled() {
349        return enabled;
350    }
351}
